1: The pink primrose features separate blooms on long stalks, each with soft pink petals and a faint yellow center in a star formation.
2: A hard-leaved pocket orchid with a pouch-like white and pink lower petal and wide speckled upper petals, set against a black background.
3: Canterbury bells with bell-shaped purple and white blossoms, featuring a prominent yellow stamen and green stems.
4: Sweet pea flowers with butterfly-shaped red and purple petals, blooming on slender green stems.
5: English marigold with vibrant yellow petals and a deep red center, blooming in a green garden setting.
6: Tiger lily with curled orange and yellow petals covered in dark spots, and long protruding stamens hanging downward.
7: Moon orchid with smooth white petals and a pale yellow and pink center, displayed in soft natural lighting.
8: Bird of paradise flower with vibrant orange and blue petals forming a striking bird-like shape, growing from a green, boat-shaped bract.
9: Monkshood flowers with deep violet, hood-shaped petals clustered along tall green stems, growing in a lush garden.
10: Globe thistle with spiky spherical flower heads in shades of lavender or white, attracting pollinators like bees.
11: Snapdragon flowers with tubular, lip-shaped blooms in vivid yellow and red-orange hues, growing in vertical clusters.
12: Colt's foot flowers with bright yellow, dandelion-like heads and thin ray-like petals, blooming low to the ground among dry grass.
13: King protea flower with large pointed red and white petals surrounding a dense, dome-shaped central cone.
14: Spear thistle with spiny green stems and a tufted purple flower head, surrounded by sharp bracts in a grassy field.
15: Yellow iris flower with bright yellow, curved petals and delicate brown markings, growing among tall green leaves.
16: Globe-flower with round, golden-yellow petals forming a ball-like bloom, standing above lush green foliage.
17: Purple coneflower with spiky central cone and drooping violet petals, growing on a tall green stem.
18: Peruvian lily with freckled pink and yellow petals and curved, trumpet-like shape, commonly seen in bouquets.
19: Balloon flower with inflated bud that opens into a star-shaped violet bloom, surrounded by pointed green leaves.
20: Giant white arum lily with a large white spathe and a yellow central spadix, standing tall among broad green leaves.
21: Fire lily with bright red, curved petals and spotted inner markings, radiating from a central stalk.
22: Pincushion flower with soft lavender petals and a dome-like center, resembling a tiny floral cushion.
23: Fritillary with bell-shaped, nodding flowers and a checkered pattern on purple petals, growing in spring meadows.
24: Red ginger with bright red bracts forming a cone-like shape, rising above glossy tropical foliage.
25: Grape hyacinth with small, bell-shaped purple flowers densely packed on a short, upright stem.
26: Corn poppy with delicate red petals and a dark center, swaying on a thin green stem in open fields.
27: Prince of Wales feathers with feathery pink plumes arranged in dense spikes above rich green foliage.
28: Stemless gentian with deep blue, trumpet-shaped flowers growing close to the ground among alpine grass.
29: Artichoke with thick green scales around a purple thistle-like flower, blooming from a large edible bud.
30: Sweet william with clustered, fringed flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, growing in rounded groups.
31: Carnation with ruffled, multi-layered petals in shades of pink or red, blooming on a slender green stem.
32: Garden phlox with clusters of small five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, purple, or white, blooming in bunches.
33: Love in the mist with delicate blue petals surrounded by fine, feathery foliage and a spiky seed capsule.
34: Mexican aster with daisy-like pink or purple flowers and a bright yellow center, blooming on long, thin stems.
35: Alpine sea holly with spiny, silvery-blue petals and a cone-shaped center, surrounded by deeply lobed leaves.
36: Ruby-lipped cattleya with large orchid blooms, featuring deep pink lips and pale petals in a fan-like arrangement.
37: Cape flower with bold, daisy-like orange or red petals and a dark central disc, standing tall in open sunlight.
38: Great masterwort with pale pink starburst petals arranged in a dome around a clustered floral head.
39: Siam tulip with stacked pink or purple bracts and small hidden flowers emerging between, growing upright.
40: Lenten rose with nodding, cup-shaped flowers in soft shades of green, pink, or burgundy and leathery leaves.
41: Barbeton daisy with vivid, flat petals in bright red, orange, or pink, radiating around a golden central disc.
42: Daffodil with trumpet-shaped yellow blooms and a central corona, surrounded by six outer petals.
43: Sword lily with tall spikes of funnel-shaped flowers in various colors, rising above narrow, sword-like leaves.
44: Poinsettia with bright red bracts resembling petals, surrounding small yellow flowers, often used in winter decor.
45: Bolero deep blue with clusters of small deep purple flowers and slightly ruffled edges, growing compactly.
46: Wallflower with narrow petals in warm shades of orange, yellow, or red, blooming in clusters on woody stems.
47: Marigold with round, layered yellow or orange blooms and a musky scent, growing in dense bushy clusters.
48: Buttercup with glossy, cup-shaped yellow petals and a small central greenish core, blooming in grassy areas.
49: Oxeye daisy with white petals and a yellow disc center, standing tall on thin green stems in meadows.
50: Common dandelion with bright yellow ray-like petals forming a flat flower head, often seen in grassy fields.
51: Petunia with funnel-shaped blooms in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, spilling over edges.
52: Wild pansy with heart-shaped petals in purple, yellow, and white tones, growing low to the ground.
53: Primula with clusters of small, bright-colored flowers on short stems, often blooming early in spring.
54: Sunflower with large yellow petals surrounding a brown central disc, following the sun as it moves.
55: Pelargonium with five-petaled blooms in pink or red, often featuring dark patterns on the upper petals.
56: Bishop of Llandaff with deep red dahlia blooms and dark purple foliage, blooming in late summer.
57: Gaura with delicate white or pink butterfly-like flowers on long wiry stems, swaying in the breeze.
58: Geranium with rounded petals in red, pink, or white, growing in compact clusters on branching stems.
59: Orange dahlia with layered, pom-pom shaped petals forming a dense round bloom in bright orange.
60: Pink-yellow dahlia with multicolored petals blending pink and yellow tones, forming a full, rounded bloom.
61: Cautleya spicata with tall, upright spikes of red and yellow flowers emerging from lush tropical foliage.
62: Japanese anemone with soft pink or white petals and a golden-yellow center, blooming on long slender stems.
63: Black-eyed susan with bright yellow petals surrounding a raised dark brown center, blooming in sunny fields.
64: Silverbush with pale, silver-green foliage and soft pink or lavender blooms, forming a low ground cover.
65: Californian poppy with cup-shaped orange petals and a delicate appearance, often blooming in sunny meadows.
66: Osteospermum with daisy-like petals in shades of white, purple, or blue and a dark central disc.
67: Spring crocus with cup-shaped purple, yellow, or white flowers emerging early from grassy ground.
68: Bearded iris with ruffled petals and a prominent central beard, blooming in vibrant blue, yellow, or violet tones.
69: Windflower with delicate white or pink petals and a yellow center, swaying on thin stems in gentle breezes.
70: Tree poppy with large crinkled yellow petals and a bright orange center, blooming on woody green stems.
71: Gazania with bold, striped petals in orange, yellow, or red, opening in sunlight and closing at night.
72: Azalea with clusters of trumpet-shaped pink or white flowers, blooming densely on compact green shrubs.
73: Water lily with broad floating leaves and a central bloom in white, pink, or yellow, resting on still water.
74: Rose with layered, fragrant petals in various colors, forming a classic spiral bloom with thorny stems.
75: Thorn apple with trumpet-shaped white or purple flowers and spiky seed pods, growing on a bushy plant.
76: Morning glory with funnel-shaped flowers in blue, purple, or white, opening in the morning and closing by noon.
77: Passion flower with intricate radial filaments and layered petals in purple or white, surrounding a complex center.
78: Lotus lotus with large pink or white petals and a prominent seed pod, rising above round, floating leaves.
79: Toad lily with star-shaped purple-spotted petals and yellow centers, blooming in shady woodland settings.
80: Anthurium with a glossy red or pink spathe and yellow spadix, growing on upright stems with large green leaves.
81: Frangipani with waxy five-petaled blooms in white, yellow, or pink, exuding a sweet tropical fragrance.
82: Clematis with star-shaped flowers in purple, pink, or white, climbing with twisting tendrils on supports.
83: Hibiscus with large, trumpet-shaped blooms and prominent stamens, appearing in vibrant tropical colors.
84: Columbine with spurred petals in soft pastel tones, resembling a cluster of hanging lanterns.
85: Desert-rose with thick succulent stems and showy pink to red blooms, thriving in arid conditions.
86: Tree mallow with large, saucer-shaped purple or pink flowers and soft green leaves, blooming on woody stems.
87: Magnolia with creamy white or pink blossoms and large, leathery leaves, often blooming before the leaves emerge.
88: Cyclamen with upswept petals in pink, red, or white, blooming low above heart-shaped, patterned foliage.
89: Watercress with small white flowers and round green leaves, growing in shallow streams and moist soil.
90: Canna lily with large banana-like leaves and bold flowers in red, orange, or yellow, blooming in upright clusters.
91: Hippeastrum with wide trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red or white, commonly grown indoors.
92: Bee balm with spiky red or purple blooms arranged in tufts, attracting pollinators in wild gardens.
93: Ball moss with grayish-green tufts of thread-like leaves, growing epiphytically on trees in humid climates.
94: Foxglove with tall spires of tubular flowers in pink or purple, often speckled inside and attracting bees.
95: Bougainvillea with vibrant magenta or red papery bracts surrounding tiny white flowers, cascading from vines.
96: Camellia with rosette-shaped blooms in red, pink, or white, set against glossy dark green leaves.
97: Mallow with soft five-petaled flowers in pink or lavender and a bushy growth habit, blooming in summer.
98: Mexican petunia with trumpet-shaped purple flowers on slender stems, spreading quickly in warm climates.
99: Bromelia with spiky, tropical foliage and a central bright flower spike in red, pink, or orange.
100: Blanket flower with red and yellow daisy-like petals and a dark cone-shaped center, blooming in dry conditions.
101: Trumpet creeper with large orange trumpet-shaped flowers climbing on vines with serrated green leaves.
102: Blackberry lily with orange petals speckled with red spots and upright sword-like leaves.
